wikipedia_page.main: John Ackroyd (born 1868) was an English  footballer who played as a forward in the Football League for Grimsby Town and Rotherham Town. In 1891−92 in a match for Grimsby against Lincoln City he scored four goals in a 6−1 victory. He also played for Heanor Town.

response: * John Ackroyd (footballer, born 1868) (1868–?), footballer for Grimsby Town and Rotherham Town
* John Ackroyd (footballer, born 1895) (1895–?), footballer for Exeter City, Grimsby Town and Rotherham County
* John Ackroyd (designer), designer of the world land speed record car Thrust2
